reviews.review_msg: The material in Chem 281 is very difficult, so don't expect the class to be a cake-walk (regardless of who teaches it). I found Dr. Samachetty very friendly, knowledgeable, and helpful. Just go to office hours (barely anyone attends, so you can ask away!). Good luck - you wil need it...
Very rude, even in class, especially when inquired about something she has already said. Also, she shows little interest in the course. Midterms Hard, Final Terrible. AVOID

Nice person but thats not enough to make her a good prof. notes are very brief and not enough examples. the final exam was the ugliest thing i have ever seen and written in my life. just make sure you do well in the lab component. on the final just try to fill in every question to get part marks.my summer was hell,but i got a C- miraclously.
The most worthless chem professor ever. Her exams are IMPOSSIBLE. Don't even go over the textbook questions cause they are super easy compared to the exam questions. DON'T TAKE CHEM WITH HEMA.
What a waste of a summer semester. Horrible teaching , hard exams. bad curve, and not very approachable, plus she tests you on stuff that she doesnt go over.NOT RECOMMENDED
if you wanna hate ur life, if u wanna hate chemistry forever, take this class with hemma!!!!

PLEASE,PLEASE,PLEASE if you have a choice not to take this prof i strongly advise you to do so. Midterms extremely hard and second midterm average was 40 percent. The whole class practically failed. PLEASE AVOID TAKING THIS CLASS WITH HER!!!!
40% midterm average, and 80% students failure, but as long as u are above everyone else, you should be happy, helpfull prof, relatively clear... but u gotta practice to get the grade.

second midterm average 40%. 80% of the students failed...enough said. Don't think she knows what she's doing (except for ruining our GPA) Just reads her slides during the lecture...I wish she could stop squeaking in every other sentence. Avoid if possible!
She is a first year prof, and hasn't quite figured it out. Some serious problems with spacing things out.

problem sets were no use for the second midterm or for the final from what it looks like. all copied from 2006.. frist exam was relatively easy... second one had an average of 40% as 80% of the class failed... hmm yes great proff... when asked for harder problem sets, she refused because no1 does them apparently, and she was happy with the averge.

He, as a person, is miserable. When you ask questions, you get belittled. When you don't ask questions, he yells at you for not participating. When you do poorly on tests, he gets very angry and treats you worse. By the end of the semester he was telling us he hated teaching us and he hated being a prof at SFU. For the love of GOD, avoid this prof.

He doesn't even deserve a 1. He's worse than that. He is the worst professor at SFU. He is rude, disrespectful, and never takes responsibility. Blames people for technical difficulties. Do yourself a favor and do not take the course with him.
Rude, ignoring, non-accommodating, impatient, complains about doing his job. DO NOT TAKE HIS CLASS. I am not a complainer and the way this class was run is below any sort of critique

One of the best profs I have ever had! Super engaging and funny, he's willing to repeat and go over any concepts that the class did not understand. Labs and exams were straight forward and fair. Final was a little bit harder. His office hours were insightful, make sure to use them to your advantage! Overall, he was funny and awesome!

Easily the best professor I've ever had at SFU. If you're  still a little boy, Nabyl will push you to become a man. I was initially intimidated and hated being called out in class, but it definitely shaped me to become a much stronger individual and student. In addition, he's phenomenal at teaching and drops valuable life lessons. U the real MVP
A mass of muscle and intellect

AMAZING ORGANIC CHEM TEACHER! He is the best teacher I have had so far at SFU. He is very straight forward and tells you exactly what you NEED to know for the exam! He likes to joke with students so he may call you out and seem intimidating, but he is actually very approachable if you have a genuine want to succeed in his course.

Nabyl is the best professor I've had at SFU so far.  He teaches well and makes sure to convey EXACTLY what is going to be expected from you on exams.  Go to your tutorials and don't fall behind on the course material, he might randomly question students during lecture and labs.  Might seem intimidating but he's very approachable.
Exceptionally prof.  Great notes and funny too.
Best prof for chemistry, hands down!
Awesome.
No Comments
p

MAN! he makes other profs look bad. He's by far the BEST organic chem prof at SFU - very clear, passionate about teaching (too bad "clarity" and "helpfulness" is only out of 5-I would give him a 10)and VERY helpful during office hours. I HIGHLY recommend him for organic chem classes.you'll LOVE it!

If you must take Organic and this guy is the one who's teaching, thank God for being lucky.  He's THE best Organic Prof.  In all honesty, the NO memorizing technique is GREAT for his class, but screws you over in a way cuz unless u have him for CHEM 282, you'll have to know the names for other profs

This guy should be the gold standard for teachers everwhere! He puts a lot of effort into making notes for lecture; often when the book confuses me, I just go to my notes and bam, instant clairity. Also, he doesn't get bogged down on all the little details and just goes for the big picture.GreatProf

The best prof ever!!!!!!!!  It sux he's not teaching for another 3 years cuz he is unbelievabely good.  I hate chem, but he actually made organic chem interesting and easy to understand.  He's so awesome.

Can you say, best prof ever?? I mean seriously, Ok..simple as this! We need more profs like this at SFU! He makes organic chem FUN, do I need to say more? He is clear, interesting, fair, not tricky and HOT. I am so glad I took his class, but too bad he is not teaching till 2008 b/c of his research.

The best prof i've ever had so far. He's interesting, clear, and very helpful during office hours. When he lectures, it's like he's having a casual conversation with you. So he speaks in a way that you can easily understand. Focuses on concepts, not memorization.

Amazing professor who explains with great clarity and precision. Doesn't give you **** info you don't need to know. Tests are on concepts. Also, it's easy to pay attention in class because a) he relates the material to the rest of the world in an interesting way and b) he is bloody good looking.
By far one of the best prof's sfu has to offer. Very brilliant, and esay to follow. One of those prof's that you will never forget..
AWESOME PROF!!! very clear and informative during lectures, and cares about students. second midterm was REALLY hard though.
awesome prof
Very dedicated. Made this bio prerequisite enjoyable and interesting. Great course.
Best teaching prof.  A very very intelligent man, yet he never makes you feel intimidated.
No Comments
branda's a great prof. no memorization. you just gotta understand the concepts, 'cause that's what's important anyways.
Bertuzzi was awesome!. He's great guy, explains things so so well. Tests are a little hard but if u do the homework you'll be fine.
he is very helpful, and encourage you to ask questions, his lecture was great.
No Comments
Awesome teacher - very helpful, always reviews previous lecture, focuses on concepts (not math!)
No Comments
Though hard exams, the best prof I ever have.
doesn't look like your typical chemistry prof. he reminds me of todd bertuzzi.

Shes a pretty good prof. Her notes are ok. Cant stress it enough but its organic chemistry. Its not meant to be a breeze. As long as you practice drawing the structures and understand the trend it isn't that hard. You will fail if you skip and don't study because its mostly drawing molecule structure language on the exam, not english memorization.

Lectures provide very clear explanations of the material. Do not count on notes being helpful, you must use your textbook. The material covered on the exams are fair, however, the questions can be difficult and it is challenging to get a good grade. Even if you understand material, you need extensive practice. LOTS OF PRACTICE. Overall, not bad.
She's a hard marker in my opinion. Read the text and co-relate it to the notes since the notes alone won't be enough >.>

O chem is a really hard subject so be prepared to put effort in. Lectures are a MUST. The notes she posts are only a few slides, she elaborates WAY more in lecture. Her exams are fair, a bit on the hard side and a bit long. Practice! Only thing I didnt like was that her office hours were always packed so sometimes tough to get proper help.
Her exams were tough and marking was unfair. Her notes were next to useless, as they has almost no information on them.
Peggy is a great prof who is passionate about what she teaches. If you aren't going to pay attention or try hard then don't expect to have a good time or get a good mark. I hope to have her again.
This prof is pretty terrible.  She is incredibly hard to understand.  Her notes are short and don't help at all, and she never seems to be around for help.
She is helpful and make sure you do the tutorial assignments every week, all the questions in her exam are directly taken from there.
Makes O-chem even harder for students.

Great prof.  Made us write out our notes by hand, which I thought would be terrible, but ended being much easier to follow the material.  She also TAed my tutorial and was great, going through every question we asked (even stupid ones!).  She was also available during office hours to answer questions and there usually was a small mob.  Got an A+.

So my far my worst post secondary experience in a class in the last 4 years. I had to hold back from verbally defending other students who were being berated, knowing my mark would be affected. After the first midterm avg. 42% we were asked what was wrong with us, because everything was clear. Avoid this prof in all future en devours.

Very bad experience with this prof. I sawin class hostility, verbal abuse and the creation of an atmosphere that clearly discouraged questions. Hard to hold my tongue during tutorials with this treatment of students, so I stopped going. Never considered going to her office hours, and she blamed us for the 36% mt avg. Turned me off the entire dept.

She is a nice woman outside of class, with a nice smile, but I did not enjoy this class very much.  The exams are very hard, and not similar to the difficulty that we were accustomed to with problem sets.  This class does not inspire me to continue on in chemistry.  Nice woman, but I think she should remember that her students are not chemists.

I silently enjoy it when she frightens students. First midterm was fair, avg. 58% but the 2nd midterm was very unfair imo. Class avg. 36%!!! Blamed US for doing bad on the 2nd midterm, but there is no excuse for 36% avg. The very few people who did good could have been repeating the course. 90% of the material is self taught.

Her lecture notes are great.  I never bought the text book and everything you need is explained entirely in the notes.  Do her tutorial study questions, she re-uses them on midterms and finals.  When you email her though make sure you say Dr. Paduraru...

Overall, I think she was a good prof...sure she is a bit intimidating, but I thought her exams were completely fair if you studied and kept up with assignments throughout the semester...It is however impossible to get a good mark in her class unless you enjoy self-teaching.

Like all Science courses, you gotta work hard for a good mark. She was tough as in she gave hard exams. The lectures felt rushed, especially the last sections. The TAs did a good job of explaining the concepts, though. Would not recommend unless you're the self-motivated type prepared to work very hard.

Don't take her unless your life depends on it. Her overall teaching is alright but her attitude towards her students is really poor. One of those profs who ruins your life forever. Exams are unfair as stated before, who puts a 5part question worth 19 marks on a final exam worth 100? Really mean, not approachable for help at all. try not to have her

Her final was THE most horrible exam I've ever taken at SFU.  Although it wasnt really cumulative, but it still was terrible.  She puts a 19 point question with 5 parts?! Such that if u screw up the first part, there goes the rest of your marks for the question.  She obviously is horrible at making exams...do not take this prof for anything!

This person is truly evil. Moody and condescending. Why does SFU hire people like this from within the department? I'm not even talking about her knowledge or ability. I'm talking about her attitude. She is a bad person. Obviously she gets a power-trip being in a position of authority. But reality check your a sessional instructor. Not impressed!

She is definitely one of the worst profs ever in SFU, her notes are 100% straight off the book, and they're just mostly straight up drawings.  Instead I find reading the book was more useful. Not only is she "hostile", but her teaching is so horrible that the class averages for the MTs were extremely low. Would not recommend taking this prof.
She's alright. She knows her stuff but wasn't really there to help out with the labs since she was teaching chem 286 at the same time.

Is a really nice prof and makes lectures enjoyable but material covered in lecture is really surface level compared to homework and exams, you have to teach yourself a lot of the concepts using resources you can find as lecture slides won't help you.

Was a great prof for a hard course.
He was very approachable and very sweet when answering questions.
Just make sure to understand the problem sets and the practice midterms and you'll be okay, know the basics. 
Tests were fair but still tough, there is a lot of content so try to stay on top of it.
Amazing professor, very funny, very accessible. Had many review sessions with practice midterms that were very representative of the final. Make sure you do the problem sets and understand them

He makes Intro to org chem passable. Great sense of humour, very approachable. His friendly demeanour and teaching style made him easy to ask questions to. lectures aren't too heavy, but good notetaking is definitely required since the PowerPoints don't make much sense if you miss the lecture. Exams are difficult, especially the final, but doable.
Dr. Vocadlo is amazing. I highly recommend taking organic chem with him as he explained the concepts really well and made ochem very easy.
This was the hardest class I've taken in my entire career and I am shocked I came out on the other side. David made it bearable, and make sense. He also cares greatly about students' wellbeing.

This course is definitely very difficult. However, The way Dr. Vocadlo teaches does help. He tends to go slow and ease into the course, ensuring you have a solid foundation for OCHEM. The exams are very similar to his practice tests. The best advice I can give is to always attend lectures, preview the lecture material, and attend office hours.

Very good prof and explains things very well! Lots of practice problem sets for tutorials that can be annoying during midterms season, but is very helpful in the long run. Practice midterms/finals are VERY similar so understand those answers and the concepts. Cool dude and is a very entertaining person

David was very clear on what would be tested. He emphasized multiple times throughout lecture what was important to know. He also offered many practice problems and practice assignments. Lectures were also very entertaining, very funny prof.

Dr Vocadlo makes Ochem easier through easy to understand lectures. He also uses iclickers, practice problems and tests to make sure we understand the material before we take our exams. Also, the exam questions are similar to or the same as the practice problems. Even though I got around a C+ to B- range, my mark was scaled to a B.

Great professor. The first midterm was simple, but just prepare for the steep climb in difficultly after midterm 1. Do the problem sets and do LOTS of practice problems for the final. I finished at around a mid 70 but that got curved to an A-. Practice midterms are EXACTLY like the real midterms, same format and question types.

Ochem is so tough, but Dr. Vocadlo made ochem more simple. His practice exams/midterms were very similar if not the same questions as on the actual exams/midterms. Be prepared to do a lot more studying outside of lectures though.

Dr. Vocadlo is an amazing prof who really cares about his students performance. CHEM281 is a very difficult course but he really tries to make it interesting and explain concepts clearly. Weekly problem sets were helpful for keeping up with material, and practice exams represented the actual exams very well.

Ochem is a hard subject but professor David made it easy to understand as long as you pay attention during lectures and do the problem sets. The tests are fair. A problem set per week(each with lots of questions) so don't procrastinate. Some lecture topics might require you to do extra work to understand fully. In short, medium difficulty.

David made Ochem, which is supposedly one of the hardest courses you can take, to be relatively simple. He's a really funny guy and his tests arent bad as you are given practice tests which are actually representative of the real exams. He may just be the goat.

professor was very passionate about the class but lectures were very fast paced. homework questions would still be assigned AND due the day after midterms. his homework, practice midterm, and midterm answer key frequently had errors in them too. a positive is that the practice exams are very similar to actual exams.

the course is hard regardless, but David acc cares for students to succeed. the problem sets are hard but they're not for marks so they are great practice for exams. provides chances for ur grade to improve and explains content well. if u go to him he will help with any questions you have. David rocks
He's not a good explainer and his problem sets are extremely long even on exam weeks.
HE DA GOAT of Organic Chem Department

Reviews look like he wrote them :/ not a bad guy, not a good ochem prof. Didn't love his lecture style (slides were confusing + so hard to get mechanisms without seeing them drawn out + iclicker too easy/didn't help. Did okay bc I studied hard (TAs were great), appreciated practice exams being so similar to real exams + amt of practice Qs given.

Dr. Vocadlo is an excellent professor who takes the time to ensure everyone understands the concept before moving on. He is always willing to answer questions and is very respectful when doing so. His teaching style is very comprehensive and easy to follow.

His lectures were well structured and had lots of good information. He generally kept it interesting and as fun as an organic chemistry lecture can be. He clearly struggles with technology, but who cares about that. Good prof for sure.

Dr.V really cares about his students and wants them to succeed. His midterms were very fair and almost the same as the practice exams. However, the final exam was much harder and focused greatly on the last quarter of the course. It can take a while to receive exam marks. Overall, he's very friendly and does his best to make the course bearable.
Difficult course but he provides concise lecture slides and resources. Lectures are entertaining and occasionally funny. Practice exams are right on track with the real exams. Amazing prof!

Professor Vocadlo made a notoriously difficult chemistry course enjoyable with engaging lectures, reasonable exams, and quality study material. 10/10 game show host with the iClicker questions in lectures!

It's a hard course but Dr. Vocadlo explained concepts really well and lectures were easy to follow. Practice exams are very helpful and similar to the exams. He showed up to our lab once and literally saved my lab. I was having trouble separating chemicals and he helped me with it. He's really nice and approachable, plus he gives good advice too.

I can't say enough good things about Dr. Britton, he was clear in his explanations, always available outside class hours, and answered every question from the class during lectures. He provided the class with many practice midterms and finals which were very similar to our actual midterms and finals. He was also a nice guy in general, and funny
Overrated prof, he's mid-prof at best (which I think is highly flattering to call him that)

I truly despised the way he conducted his lectures as in did not post any notes. That was the most frustrating part and made my life way more difficult than needed. Otherwise yeah he is a mid prof. His exams aren't like that difficult he just puts ridiculous amount of questions and theres like no time to finish which was a pain
No offense but a very overrated prof

Everything was just easy at first, and I even got close to 80% in the first midterm. But materials later got ridiculously hard and exams were extremely different to the practice midterms he gave, leaving merely a 50% average. Also he put MANY iclickers on the same few lectures which I COINCIDENTLY missed, directly took almost 4% of my final score.
His classes okay and he is a chill prof. Exams are hard but he gives a lot of practice questions and the actual exams are a lot similar which makes it easier to study.
Professor Britton is a very nice professor to have if you already understand the course materials and are only seeking for chill lectures. Otherwise, he is not recommended.
One of the nicest professor but also the worst at teaching

Dr. Britton is a great professor. He doesn't have any lecture slides and writes all his notes in class so attending lectures is definitely encouraged. The material itself is difficult but Dr. Britton is extremely helpful when you go to him for help during his office hours.

Dr. Britton is amazing. Organic chem is pretty challenging but he makes it very manageable. He is pleasant, knowledgeable, and well respected and he goes to lengths to ensure that his students are cared for. His practice exams are very helpful for exam prep. All his work is greatly appreciated.

One of the best professors I've ever had. The topics covered were interesting (though may appear challenging at first). He is excellent at explaining principles and building an intuitive understanding of key concepts. Midterms and the final were fair and can be prepared for effectively. He was inspiring and helped me grow fond of Organic Chemistry
Rob is a very approachable prof who has very clear and straightforward lectures. If you put the effort in the lectures and tutorials you won't have any problem passing ochem.
The prof made the exam way harder than expected.

Dr. Britton is an absolute legend. He is extremely caring, charismatic and fun professor. Chem281 is very tough course but he made it so fun and engaging that I would definitely take another course with him. I know you gonna see this Dr. Britton. THANK YOU!
good prof

Rob makes lectures very interesting and makes complicated topics easy to understand. The exams are tough, but he gives practice exams which are similar in structure to the actual exams and were useful. This is a tough class, but Rob makes it bearable.

MADE MY LIFE 100X EASIER. ochem is a breeze with him just put in a bit of effort and watch that gpa flourish. still waiting for the final but the 2 midterms were easy peasy with senor roberto. No homework, just tutorials,iclicker, 2 midterms, and a final. No notes are provided so he writes while he talks which is the only thing that sucks.
Robert makes an incredibly hard course manageable. Exams are challenging but the layout is identical to the practice exams.

I see he's gotten a lot of 5's for difficulty but its an ochem course so thats expected. I was really scared coming into this class, but Robert makes ochem not so scary. He's an amazing prof and have amazing lectures. If you want to actually understand ochem, he's the prof for you!

One of the best professors I've had so far! Robert is a great professor and really helps you understand ochem. His lectures and examples are clear and he encourages questions for clarification throughout the lectures. Do the practice midterms and you're set for the exams. Highly highly recommend!!

dear professor,

i wanted to say that you made chem 281 bearable and interesting. i could tell that you're super passionate in chemistry. when you said that you almost failed this course back in your university days, it gave me hope. 

p.s. please teach chem 282, thank you.
This professor is highly recommended, if you want to fail chemistry.

I must say this professor is really nice and funny as a person, he always makes the class laugh and keep us entertained! He also gives no homework so that there is no official in-class resources for us to practice what we have learned! More importantly, his midterms are so easy that we have such a high average of 51%! Recommended!

Super chill prof, teaches very well and is easy to follow along with. No homework. The midterms are a copy and paste of the practice midterms he provides - do those and you will do great in the class.

Dr. Britton is very approachable and knowledgable. His lectures are enjoyable and he posts multiple practice midterms that are very similar to the actual exam. I would hands-down take more courses with him. He made the intro to ochem enjoyable.

he is very nice and approachable but the exam is hard asf. the lectures are good, and he teaches very well with little confusion but you need to practice a lot to get a good mark on the exam because the examples he does in class are simple.

The lectures themselves seemed decent with little confusions and the professor was nice. But it went downhill really quickly with the exams because they were a complete different level compared to the lectures. His lectures covered only the most basic tings of the topics, which would NEVER solely prepare you for the exams.

Notes were unorganized which made it hard to review them. Didn't give us any information about the exams or give us any practice exams until a couple days before the exam. Midterms were way harder than any practice questions we were given but the final ended up being decent. Good thing was that the class was curved a lot.

Dr. Britton is a great professor! I do truly love how he had handwritten the lecture notes and how concise they were. The best thing about how he handled CHEM 280 was that his midterms/final was actually LIKE the practice midterms/final he gave out, which was great. Also, he scales the exam grades up which can really help too.
LOVE THIS INDIVIDUAL
I have Robert this semester online, and his exams are clear and reasonable. He is very understanding and wants all his students to do well. I love Robert.

I. love. this. man. He is so funny and approachable and really makes the course content interesting and enjoyable. If you are required to take organic chemistry, definitely take it with Rob. He understands his students and truly wants them to learn. He is relatable as he often uses his personal experiences to connect with students. He is amazing!

Robert is honestly the best chemistry prof Ive ever had! His notes are all written on an overhead so make sure to sit at the front, sometimes Iclicker questions for participation marks and he curves like a hero!! He is very nice and really approachable for help and is actually willing to help his students succeed and pass the class! RECOMMENDED!

I struggled a lot in this class because Robert handwrites all the notes and never posts them. If you don't take good and organized notes like me, when the exam comes, you will have nothing to study to. However, Dr. Brittons' lectures are good. The curve is also really lenient! I got 60 in lab and 1 midterm and still ended up with an A.

Robert is a great prof, he hand writes the notes in lecture which I like although his writing could be hard to read at times. He gives plenty of examples which are helpful to the material. Still unbelievable how I passed the course. He scales the midterms to the highest mark someone got on it.

An extremely passionate prof who cares about your learnings. He understands that this course is challenging but he will answer all your questions. He has a great sense of humour and his jokes make lectures much less dry. He doesnt post lecture notes so be sure to show up for all classes. Exams are brutal, but he will scale the grades heavily.

Rob is such a great professor for me. He is extremely funny, and he makes class pass by extremely quickly! His notes are handwritten, so be sure to be there for lectures. He will not post them unless certain circumstances. However, his exams are fair. If you do tutorial questions and his practice exams, you will be able to do well! :)

Robert is the best professor I have had at SFU so far, I can't reccomend him enough. He understands that this is a brutally hard class and he does his best to make it as simple as possible. You can tell he genuinely cares about his teaching and he wants his students to succeed and will do everything he can to help them pass.
This guy is a straight homie, like honestly saved my life in o-chem, Love him, super funny, and his hand written notes really help in understanding the course.

Dr. Britton somehow was able to help me pass his course with his extremely simple, straightforward and clear teaching style. You have to attend every one of his lectures,or have some friends taking notes in the class, as he typically does not use handouts or slides but instead hand write everything on a projector slide.

If i took this course with a different prof, I would've failed and had to retake it. Robert Britton is a blessing, literally. He is generous in terms of marking and he simplifies the materials well. His notes are good and his writing can sometimes be illegible. Exams are fair except for the time limit.

This was a hard course but Robert made it really easy to understand. His midterms were EXACTLY like his practice midterms, so if you learn the concepts and can do the practice midterms you can score really good on the tests (although he gives LOTS of questions to complete in 45 minutes). The final exam was a bit harder than the midterms.

Tries his best to make sure his students understand the material and very fair exams. I think he turned a hard course into a relatively okay to understand course but you also have to put in the work yourself. He writes his notes which is incredibly helpful and keeps you busy during lectures. Not a lot of practice material though
Top lad!

Robert is the best professor i've had at SFU so far. He is very good at explaining concepts and is very accessible for help. His notes are clear, although his handwriting isn't the best. If you work hard and are dedicated to doing well, it will be reflected in your grades. Lost of chances for partial marks.
Made a relatively hard class pretty easy to understand

Britton is excellent. I doubt I would've passed this class if it wasn't for him. He writes out all his notes in class and doesn't post them, so you have to go, but it's definitely worth it. Amazing at answering student's questions as he understands their thought process. This man is a gift.

Great prof, explains things very clearly, encourages questions. The course itself is super hard but he does a good job at teaching. He goes a bit fast, he doesn't post his notes so you should show up for lecture. Exams are fair, however very time constrained. No homework, so not a lot of practice material.
he is a great person, but not the best prof. I did not like the fact that he wrote notes while teaching and that he didnot post them.
Overall great prof with good lectures/notes and fair exams. If you listen in class and do lots of practice you'll be fine

Rob was a really great prof he makes a very hard class significantly easier as he explains concepts thoroughly and takes exam material directly from lecture. His class notes are very important to keep organised in order to do well. Rob is very approachable and creates a great environment in lecture and his office hours.

Britton is a charismatic prof who seems to genuinely care about teaching his students. I recommend focusing on taking his notes (as he makes them in lecture and doesn't post them) and studying them at home (practice is necessary!) He makes his tests passable, and often scales at least one midterm-- however, this is a difficult course so work hard.

He doesn't post his notes, instead he writes them by hand so you have to follow along and copy them down. I found that this way was very helpful but you definitely need to copy notes from someone if you're going to be away. Notes were good enough for studying for the exams. Explains topics in good detail and will gladly answer any question in class

Rob is a great prof honestly. The material in this class is pretty difficult and he tries his absolute best to make it was simple as possible. The exams were a little difficult but all were fair. Attend his office hours if you can they were very helpful.

Really nice prof. Writes notes in class but it's hard to keep up with how fast he writes. Notes themselves are pretty good but imo you're better off using the textbook with the notes as supplementary material. Exams were hard but fair. Material gets much harder after the first midterm. It took a lot of effort but i would recommend this class

Dr. Britton is hilarious and very approachable. If you practice everyday and keep up with the work the material will be easier to understand moving forward in the course. His exams are tough but O chem in itself is hard to understand at first but once you get the basics the rest of it is just expansions of the same topic.

Rob is a great guy, and will go the extra mile to help you if you show you care. I'd highly recommend going to his office hours as his explanations were fantastic in a one on one setting. He does handwritten notes so make sure you pre-read the textbook before lecture so you understand what's going on. Everything on the tests is from his notes.

He's a genius. If you can't get an A on his exams you never will get an A, ever. If you failed his class, choose another career path (seriously). All the exams were fair, and he prepares you thoroughly. His lectures are like khan academy for ochem.

where do i start off. At first he was a great prof at teaching but if u dont listen well, you wont get anything you write in your notebook cause he goes pretty fast. Heres how to study for his class: MAKE SURE YOU CAN DO THE SAMPLE MIDTERMS, always do the tut questions no matter what. and if u dont get his lecture just go for the textbook

Very clear and helpful prof. Do Do Do his problem sets and absolutely no room for procrastination ! His second midterm is way harder than the first one ... study his notes well and get a chemistry textbook it really helps.

First half of the course he spends way too much time on and goes super slow, and when it starts to get hard he just whips through the material so fast. He's obviously really funny and nice, so everything seems great until you realize he absolutely sucks at teaching. Very disorganized lectures, which makes it really difficult to follow along. I've been teaching myself everything.
class seemed fun at first, spent way too much time on basic parts of the course and then rushed the hardest parts. 2nd midterm and final were hard i pretty much learned mostly out of the text.

Very happy I took Chem281 with Dr. Pete. He made the course as painless as possible for his students. Be sure to do the problem sets as soon as he assigns them. The practice exams will save your grade. He is so funny and pleasant for absolutely every lecture. With more effort I'm confident a non chem major like me could have gotten an A.
CHEM 281 is very difficult but Dr. Pete is super helpful. Go to his office hours if you have any questions. Don't fall behind in this class because the second half of the course has so much material.

Isn't the worst, but isn't the best. I loved that he gave practice exams so you always knew what to expect. He was also very willing to help and approachable. The Halloween class was the best. NUMBER ONE THING I HATED. He was sooo hard to follow and was all over the place, but from what I've heard he is one of the better profs. 7.5/10

Fantastic proffessor! Stays outside of the lecture hall after every lecture to talk with students who have questions or need help. Ive never seen him be anything less than completely helpful and approachable
Study the textbook because it will really explain what is happening.

It is SO IMPORTANT that you read the textbook actively. The syllabus he posts is not followed (at all) so you have to pay attention to what he's lecturing on and keep up withyour readings based on that. If you do that you will love his class. He's funny and friendly and a very good teacher, just slightly not organized when it comes to syllabuses.
great prof, very enthusiastic and willing to help. He doesn't follow the text book chapter by chapter but its not his job to. keeps the class interesting with jokes and great experiments :)
great guy, funny, and an awesome prof....go to class...listen to him, understand and do his practice exams (actual exams are exactly like the practice ones) and you're set for an easy A or B

I honestly don't understand why everyone's saying he's a horrible prof. He is very helpful and so are his lectures. He just explains most of his notes orally, so if you don't pay attention, you can't just get by on his written notes alone. This class actually has me very interested in chemistry, and thanks to him, I now want to major in chemisty.

completely useless prof talks about stupid things all day long that doesnt make sense and tries WAY too hard to be funny. doesn't really follow the textbook and jumps all over the place. terrible exeperience with this prof

Awesome prof.  He really made the course interesting, as well as informative.  Put up a 'what you need to know' file before the exam containing every one of the 50-odd reactions taught in class, as well as most concepts.

Good friendly prof.  Compared to other organic chem class, the course is very easy.  If you have hard time reading his notes, go to his lectures!  His exams are easy if you do practice midterms and finals on his website.  Lots of cool demonstration and funny jokes.
He's a very good Prof. and likes to make organic chem as easy as possible.

Horrible notes, no point in going to class. very unorganized, and all over the place. Though he does have quite the sense of humour..a little on the moody side too. And leaves people with questions having their hand in the air for five minutes and longer, however long they can hold em up there...i think he thinks its funny....

The course is lovely when it commences. It is simple and you may wonder why people describe this class as diffucult. Then after the first midterm things get swearin' hard. It's quite silly, really. The labs are better than for 121 and 126, and there is no mandatory homework for the lecture which is just dandy.

he was great, the course was challenging but that's the course itself.  DO THE PRACTICE EXAMS -he always uses the same format.  another thing, it wouldn't hurt to do a little sucking up... people would carry his molecular models to his office sometimes haha! (not me- I don't brown nose)

A great prof. Spends an insane amount of time helping students with questions during and outside of office hours.  Very approachable, willing to help, and an interesting speaker with good Halloween demonstrations.  Sexy too!
great prof, prepares you very well for the exams, lots of practice problems and practice exams to do, you will do well in this course if u work hard

Good Prof.  His exams are only on the stuff that were taught in the class.  The concept are challenging.  Pay great deal of attention when he explains the mechanisms because he goes over them very fast!

He focuses on mechanisms in class, but his exams are all about memorizing reagents. His exams are challenging but ok if you know your reagents. His lectures aren't that great...doesn't offer the best explanations for a lot of concepts.

He's hard but he doesn't test you on thigns taht he never mentioned. He's to get u the best grade you can get. Besides, he drinks beer at the pub more often than ne one i know! U can't hate someone like that!
hardest final ever. i heard that the average was well below 50%. he is a good guy, good instructor but i think he likes to see ya sweat.
He taught this course well.  I liked him as a professor.  Right from the beginning, he made this course very interesting and fun.
Great lecturer, good notes, sometimes tough (but fair) tests, very willing to help. Great prof.

Lectures are fun. Though sometimes are too fast because there is a vast amount of material to cover. His Chem281 is a nice introduction to 282, which helps a lot. Exams are scared at first, but are okay. In general, a very good prof to have at SFU.

Very nice prof and neat writing.  However, his teaching can jump all over the place sometimes and his exams are difficult because each question consists of 10 to 15 subportions.  Willingly posts his own old exams but all are structurally very different.

He seems to be a friendly person. However, I have observed that he doesn't like to give an outline of chapter references in the book (which bothers many students).On exams, to get the next question, you must answer the previous 10 right. very challenging
great prof..who is very enthusiastic about the course. the exams are difficult tho. just keep up with the problem sets and u should be in good shape .
very hard exams. practice and the real one doesn't match
Good Prof, he explains concepts very well, and cares a lot about the students, course material is challenging though, exams are fair to challenging

By far the worst professor I have had. As an upper year, I thought I had seen it all. I just wrote the final exam today - Not one person left before 2 hours and after 3 hours more than 90% of the class still writing or not finished. be more lively and kick life to your classes. provide notes online and be available like Dr. Kreis (no appointments!!)

Organic chem with Plettner was a most unpleasant experience.  Her primary attributes: ignoring students' raised hands, illegible writing, occasional hostility, impatience and a generally unapproachable demeanour.  Not a good teacher.

I currently hold a decent grade in this course. I still have an extreme dislike for this professor. Poor attitude, clear she doesn't want to be there, arrogant, mildly ****. She should not be in contact with students whatsoever - should stick to pure research. Chem should not be so hard/depressing

Makes beginning organic chem difficult. She always tell us to refer to the text, which the text itself is a horrible one. Problem sets are not meant for students to do, but to copy the answers down from the TA.
Ugh. Terribly disorganized and slightly batty.  The textbook is useless if you don't follow it.  She's always late for lectures and then gets angry when people try to leave at 20 past.

please speak out loud. chemistry was very entertaining with Dr. Kreis. also try and follow the book, the Ta is more clear than you. we have to storm the tutorials to understand the material. be at ease while teaching. exams are hard and some questions totally out of topic. hope not to meet u again.

can't talk to her at all. Need to book an appointment a week in advance. Tests are marked unfairly. and with an average on a midterm of 56% she isn't going to curve the grades. Good luck with her. I'll see you in chem 281 next semester

please dress upand stand up right in class. organize your notes abit more. SPEAK UP! or use the mic. tests are hard and lectures boring. relate to the book and be clear and confident about the points you're making. u suck!!

Disorganised and poorly spoken, her lectures lack direction and purpose. Moreover, she speaks with no correlation to the text (let alone able recommend what sections to read). Organic chemistry is a very logical topic - except with Dr. Plettner.
The optional textbook he recommends in the syllabus teaches you better than his lectures.

horrible prof. lectures are completely useless, confuses himself. fill in the blank (incomplete) slides posted. exam information (concrete, such as question format/layout of the exam) given only 24hrs before the exam. does not provide nearly enough practice for what is for most students the first ochem class they have ever taken. grades crazy harsh

OChem is a difficult course regardless of the professor. Khaled was good in the sense that his lectures were comprehensive and his exams related to the lectures. Office hours are full because he goes into depth answering questions. Nothing is confusing about having him as a prof and makes Organic Chemistry seem simpler than it is.
Horrible
He is one of my favorite professors. He explains the concepts very well. Totally recommended
Khaled is one of the best chem profs you can get - if you get the chance to take a class with him, take it!!!
He is bad

Chem 283 Summer 2022 semester. Do yourself a favour and NEVER take a course with this prof EVER in your life. He is super difficult to understand due to his accent and his lectures are extremely dry. Also, he expects you to know +10-20 mechanisms that he only spends 30 secs in class, on the exams, with type of questions you have never seen before.

Khaled was a very nice instructor, and made chemistry one of my favourite classes at the time. His lectures were easy going. Exams are very fair and as long as you study hard, you should be able to get a good grade.

he could easily cut lecture time in half if he stopped rambling about irrelevant information and was just straight to the point. his lectures heavily exceed the appropriate lecture time- each lecture video is almost up to 2 hours long despite given very little information about the course (with poor explanations).
great prof, chem 281 is not an easy class but this prof does an excellent job teaching the material. do practice problems!

Khalid skips over most in-depth explanations and over simplifies topics, however leaves most difficult concepts to teach two days before the midterm. His lecture notes are taken right out of Bruice Organic Textbook and his slides have no context, reading the textbook and doing the practice questions is more helpful than showing up for class.

Not an easy course, but still understandable and interesting to learn thanks to Dr. Arafeh's hard work and clear explanation. I was worried when the course became online because of the panademic situation but Dr. Arafeh makes the transition to online system smooth and easy.

He "taught" 4 chapters in 4 weeks. He covered 1 entire chapter in a 50 minute lecture 4 days before a midterm and told us that ALL of it is going to be covered on that midterm. Get ready to spend hours teaching yourself the entire course because you're definitely not going to learn anything from a professor who spends 10 seconds on one slide.
The course is quite hard and time consuming but khaled is good at explaining procedures thoroughly and makes sure everyone is on the same page

1. Go to lecture 
2. Go to tutorial 
3. Spam the problem sets while understanding the concepts 
4. Exams are easy if you do problem sets and practice final and clicker questions
5. This class WILL be scaled average typically sits low so dont feel discouraged
Had this prof for 281 and 282. No complaints

CHEM 282- dr. somers was one of the best o chem professors. i was really scared for o chem 2 but this class was not that bad, only if you are studying and doing additional problems to mkae sure you get the concepts. the midterm and final were fair, no tricks, everything was based on what she taught you :)

This is for chem 282: did NOT scale even though the avg was LOW AND its intercession. did not tell us how many questions would be on exams/ not allow questions to be asked during exams! exams were not difficult but with the short amount of time given she makes them purposefully difficult.
I was so scared for ochem but prof somers made it a breeze! Especially her tests, no tricks the final was pretty tough though emphasis on mechanisms but keep practicing and don't fall behind

orgo isnt an easy class but her lectures made everything super clear and they were super helpful. problem sets had questions that were somewhat harder than the questions she would go through in class. theres a quiz every week in tutorial but its super chill as long as you understood the problem set. great prof
Wish her problem sets would show the steps, not always clear how she got the answer. Explains concepts well. Intimidating for face-face interaction.

Orgo is not an easy course. Honestly I did find it a bit hard. But having Patricia as a prof really helped it ease down a bit cuz she's nice and takes her time to explain content. I did find notes and problem sets a bit less difficult than exam questions tho and struggled to do well on them.

She needs to work on her attitude, NOT approachable at all, I understand most OCHEM profs are bad and people like patty, but honestly not a fan of her at all. Wish she would do more practice questions, she teaches the material but gives situation we weren't taught.

Really great prof, notes/slides were clear and gave a lot of in-lecture participation and explained answers well. tutorial assignments were also very useful. Go to class and tutorial and do the work. Practice midterms and final were very similar to actual exam.

Dr. Somers explains chemistry clearly and thoroughly. Her lectures contain simple definitions and many examples to solidify her students' understanding. There is a fair amount of homework, but it is very helpful in aiding student understanding. 

Between her lectures and assigned homework, you will find no surprises on the exams. 

10/10 prof.
W prof.

Definitely one of my favourite profs. Her lectures were very clear and she provided many practice problems for each chapter. Her exams were very fair and relatively similar to practice. Labs were pretty fun and easy as you're given lots of time and can talk about the lab report with the people around you (unlike both gen chems). Great prof!

Wouldn't recommend her for the chem281 lectures, as for lab, TAs make or break your lab and I'm so glad I had a supportive TA that was there to help when the prof wasn't. Try avoiding her unless you want to teach urself the course concepts. online textbook doesnt teach jack even though it's required readings + problems ( waste of money +time)
Great prof! She was very caring and wanted her students to succeed. OChem was a hard class no matter who you take it with. Her exams were fair with no suprizes.

Dr. Somers is one of the best ochem profs you can get. Explains very clearly, exams are fair, very accessible and explains everything well. Put in the work and you will do well. Labs were fun and you're given plenty of resources to practice everything.

If you don't take her as your 281 prof, you are going to miss out. Her lectures are going to be extremely clear, and allows you to understand the materials EVEN better, on the premise that you have read the topic beforehand! The course will heavily depend on how well you understand all the textbook materials she gives you.
Very polite and willing to help, do lots of practice questions and you will be fine. Exams are fair.

Prof Somers is really great, in fact one of the best organic chem profs there are; she teaches you everything you need to know very clearly and is accessible outside of class. Exams are fair. If you put in the work, you will do very well in this class.
Nice and polite.

Prof Somers was an amazing professor that I had. Her lectures are so clear and are also accessible at the canvas. And the best part is that she takes 3 midterms and drops the one lowest score.  Also, she is very polite and accessible outside the classroom. Her exams are a bit hard but if you follow along, you will be able to to good.
Really enjoyed Prof Somers, her exams were difficult but fair. She was always available during office hours.

Her lectures are so unclear and always explains things in the most unclear way possible. She talks with a lot of hesitation and mumbling its hard to follow. You dont know what the lecture will even be about because her notes are empty and you only have an ambiguous heading as insight. Not a good setup for an orgo class.

He is amazingly patient and very dedicated to his students. He's always smiling and makes jokes throughout the lectures. SFU should hire him full-time, not just for the summer, SFU needs a professor like him!

Great prof; one of the best I've had. He really cares about how well his students do and it shows in how much time he spends helping them, as well as extending office hours if needed. His notes are really all you need for reading, but you will need the textbook for chapter review questions. All-in-all, one of my favorite profs.
Guys a down prof, just go to class and read over your notes and you'll be fine, he kinda rushed at the end but wasnt even that bad, take o chem with him if u can, hes pretty funny too

Overall I thought he did a good job. The class honestly isnt that hard, like anything put in time and effort and youll do well. I do agree with the difficult marking scheme.. 4 marks for a question but you either get 0, 0.5 for trying , or 4. Also his lack of organization and additional lectures REALLY ticked me off.  In the end a good prof.

Really really hard marker, only gives full marks for the final answer. Doesn't give marks for process and explanation. Notes are pretty organized and an enthusiastic prof. Just really really hard exams and midterms. Exam questions are way harder than the ones in tutorials and textbook.

Honestly the best prof I've ever had. I mean the material's super hard but you can't blame the prof for that. The exams I've heard are more fair than other profs, and if you put in the time, you will get the results. Prof strongly encourages questions and will extend office hours. Agree with previous entries that he did not plan lectures well, and now the students suffer because of it. His final is 40% of the stuff he had to rush through, students are relying on textbook to learn complex reactions, which is not what we paid for.

I haven't had his final exam yet, but I thought I'd say that he did not time his lectures properly and had to schedule several additional evening lectures in order to compensate. Also, because of this he had to rush through the last 5 chapters of material in two weeks. Completely ridiculous!

This class is definitely on the more challenging side. Professor Oba is very good at explaining concepts, but prepare to be blindsided during exams. Many questions were based on simpler models from lectures, but VERY challenging. But then again, it's OCHEM. Pretty good overall!
This guy made me love organic chem! I wish he taught at SFU more!
Nicest guy you'll ever meet and he's always willing to help you out with any questions

Awful teacher who does not deserve any respect. Has anger issues within the lab and cannot contain his ego, causing him to lash out to a unnecessary extent on students as early as second year. Taught my Chem281 lab. Provides fantastic pre-lab videos that explain the whole lab. Labs are easy, as long as you can follow instructions. Merbouh's over-inflated rating is due to the students who thrive on academic validation and lack self-respect. I think it says a lot that I've met alumni and other students across my time at SFU (spanning like 10 years) and we all collectively trauma bonded over this prof. He's SFU's Madame Pomfrey. He has a terrible attitude. De-motivated his students and thinks highly of himself. He is the worst professor that I have come across at SFU. I have no idea who thought he should teach because he does it so so poorly. Passed by studying from youtube because his classes were of 0 help.

potential to be a great prof. smart, teaches the material well. Unfortunately his attitude is exceptionally poor. Exam marks will have to be earned from very precise answers (no bs-ing). Despite all the negatives, he is one of the best lecturers at SFU by far.
I would like to take my time here to thank the organic chem tutor for helping me pass this course because goddamn wtf.

never had such a prof as rude and heartlesss as him. do not take any class w him unless its just the lab portion

Never can take responsibility for his mistakes and is always ready to blame students for everything. Very hard marker and does not make his expectations clear what so ever.

He explains well during the lectures, but that is perhaps the only good thing about him. Unfortunately, it does not cover all the stress and frustration that comes with that. I don't get how this prof has a 4.3 . He should be a -4.3. He is the worst prof you can have in any university. All he does is yell at you and is also not a great person to ask for help for. DONT TAKE A CLASS WITH HIM. DO NOT DO IT YOU WILL REGRET IT

Worst prof ever! Nabyl was the kind of prof that made you feel dumb, his lectures were super fast pace and he expected you to know everything. His exams were hard and he doesn't believe in part marks, you either get it right or wrong. So good luck if you choose to take a class with him.

Honestly if you like a prof who yells at you, doesnt answer questions properly without making you feel dumb or embarrassed and like learning off powers point slides then, Dr. Nabyl is the prof for you. I took this class looking at his rating and its honestly my worst mistake ever!! After his class I hated chem, my major and wanted to switch out.

Dr. Merbouh has a lot of knowledge about organic chemistry. His lectures are very interactive and fast-paced, so be ready to answer lots of questions. Although this quality may be beneficial for some people, others look at it as a source of his demeanour. His expectancy of your knowledge during class can make the lectures unnecessarily stressful.

Nabyl is a great prof he is really funny and engaging in his lectures. He makes great connections to real life and is thorough in his explanations. Also, he really emphasizes what to spend time on and what you can skip over. Overall the course itself is kinda difficult but he does a great job of making it more understandable.

Dr. Merbouh is a good prof, but is also a pretty strict guy! DO NOT BE ON UR PHONE OR HE WILL CALL U OUT AND BE MAD! He explains concepts fairly well, but is pretty fast. Go to his office hr when not too many ppl, cause he will openly help out. Just make sure you go prepared knowing some basics to your questions before going for help. Practice lots

Organic chemistry is difficult, especially if it is your first time, but Dr. Merbough strives to make it approachable. But you still must put in work; you must do practice problems. If ever you are feeling lost visit hm and ask for some help, he is there and ready to help you understand. Practice and understand concepts; don't memorize answers.

The most amazing Prof I've ever had, he really cares about his students, gives tons of practice questions, he explains the concepts thoroughly and his exams are very I've never had a prof put so much effort in for his students. If you get a chance to take the class with him, do it. This has been my highest mark, in Chem 121 and 122 I got a C+.

Nabyl has changed my perception of how I viewed my education. The best professor I have had in my entire educational journey. Truly cares about his students and goes the extra mile to make sure they are understanding the concepts. Highly inspirational and helps you realise your potential. May seem tough at first but a VERY good prof! Exams are fair

He will scare the living daylights out of you but he's a great prof. If you show him you're working hard, he will work hard to make sure you get the best grade possible. He likes to yell at people, but don't take it personally. Honestly I'd rather have him yelling at me everyday than take this course with another prof. Also he's hilarious.

He is responsible for his students, always in a good mood, very knowledgeable & one of the funniest profs I've ever had. He makes his students motivated and inspires them by his lectures .he has a lot of experience & expects you to do the work and will help you if you are confused. learnt a lot from him!don't miss ur chance of having him as a prof
AMAZING PROF. VERY GOOD LOOKING. A+ 1010 WOULD RECOMMEND
Loved this course. It takes work but u ll enjoy it.

Very intimidating at first, but turned out to be a pretty nice. His notes are very clear, and literally tells you which parts will be on the exams. Lectures are enjoyable and easy to understand or will give extra examples if the class looks lost. Exams are fair, and straightforward. Review sessions are really helpful. Great prof!
BEST PROF I HAVE EVER HAD!!!

Easily the best prof I've had at SFU. Funny, engaging and has no problem going back over difficult material, but only if you speak up. Even if you get a question wrong in class he'll praise you for the effort (but probably mock you a little too) and explain in detail about where you went wrong. Try and take 281 with him.

One of the best profs I've ever had.  He's very good at what he does but you have to make sure you pre-read because if you get picked on in class and don't know the answer, he won't forget it and won't let you either.  As long as you try on your part, he's really willing to help out.  He's really good looking too.

Amazing prof. In his own words, "really really straightforward." Lectures are not only informative but also entertaining. Midterms were fair but final was a bit unexpected. You realize one thing and one thing only. You only have to worry about the lecture slides he asks you to "put a heart around" then "life becomes really really easy."

Worst prof. Your better off to read the textbook. His notes are pieces from the textbook copy and pasted. He's rude and not a good prof   He doesn't seem interested in teaching but just does it for the money. Pretty funny looking guy.

Egotistic but the best prof at SFU, this man speaks his mind and no f@#$s are given. Lab portion is an easy 25% which makes his lecture exams weigh less. If you honestly try, you'll walk out with ATLEAST a B. Get ready to be responsive in lecture and will call you out in front of the entire class( for using phone, talking, not taking notes etc)
Definitely the best prof I've ever had, super funny, really cool guy. Always available for help but not that nice if you come to his office hour asking stupid questions.

Merbouh was an excellent prof - articulate, funny, held many much needed review sessions. His singular goal was to prepare us for CHEM 282. Exams were fair, and the lab was easy and interesting. Definitely take 281 with him.

He's good.  He makes ochem quite eeasu for someone who lacks chem background. Just keep up with his tutorial questions and extra problems. Then should do well on exams. He's very fair.  I did much better in ochem then 121/122.

Excellent professor for two main reasons. First, he knows how to teach, and how to teach well. This is shown in how he emphasizes key components, the amount of extra tutorials he holds, and the need for his class to pay attention. Second, he doesn't baby you. He's tough; University requires hard work if you want to move on bigger and better.

Best prof I've had at SFU so far :) Great lecturer, and holds tons of review sessions. Merbouh genuinely cares about his students and wants them to do well. He also really funny and easy-going, people who say he's mean probaby didn't make an effort to actually talk to him. Make sure you do your work though, Merbouh can totally tell if you haven't!

Merbouh is a phenomenal prof. If you want an Ochem Prof Merbouh is the one you want. He is tough, but with keen dedication the material isn't too bad; it is just dense. Read your notes ahead so you're not overwhelmed by reactions. Merbouhs passion for chemistry and good humor make lectures entertaining; however, attendance is necessary! Lab is easy
Best prof I've ever had. Funny, speaks loud and clearly. Difficult course but not bad if you keep up.

great professor, he tells you in his lecture whats going to be on the test, and before each exam he reviews the material out of his own personal time. i know he is a bit intimidating but that is his style. he was highly recomended and also will recomend unfortunate that he took the summer off or i woul have taken 282 do as many question from book.

Merbouh is intimidating, and has no tolerance for laziness, but if you stand up to him, and show that you're working your butt off, he will respect you. His lectures are clear, and only the NMR exam is too difficult. The rest were very fair. The course is tough, but if you go for help, he will help you. And try to get into his lab! It helps!

Great lectures, clear powerpoint, and lots of examples done in class so you know exactly what he is looking for on exams. Midterms/finals difficult but fair w/ some questions straight out of tutorials/lectures. Runs his class better than any prof at SFU w/ zero tolerance for texting, chatting, etc. Came recommend and would recommend
He's one of the best profs I've ever had!! :)

First of all let me say...THIS MAN IS SEXY!!! yes i know that is innappriate for me to say..but lets be honest here, I enjoyed watching him give lectures rather then listen to him lol. on the other hand, he's a wonderful prof. INTIMIDATING at times but you really knows how to get the message across...HIGHLY RECOMMEND HIM...MY FAVORITE TEACHER YET!

Great prof! Funny guy, but might be a bit rude to a few students. Don't ever fall asleep, or take your phone out in his class, as he will kick you out. His exams are not too hard, but he scares you into studying for them. If you put the effort into the course, you will get a really high grade. You don't need to be smart, just hard working (srsly)

So great! Expects a lot from students and there is a lot of homework required. You definitely need to attend lectures to know what's going on but he is pretty funny and his french accent will charm you!

Best Prof I have ever had at SFU. Hard as hell, and you will fail if you don't bust your ass, but still somehow the best prof I've had. Great teacher, genuinely cares if the students can understand, and always tries to make lectures interesting.

he is the best prof out there! trust me, you will learn a lot if you have me! he pushes you to work hard and it is worth it. his exams are fair- he tells you beforehand whats on it! lectures are interesting, he has a sense of humor and sarcasm (get used to it). YOU HAVE TO TAKE ORGO WITH HIM! MY WORD! NO OTHER ORGO PROF AT SFU IS BETTER THAN HIM.

You get what you get. If you don't study, you will fail. And be aware on the tutorial quiz. I can't believe one tutorial quiz is worth 5% of the whole term. I didn't attend that tutorial and ends up being rejected from A. I got an A-.

One of thee best profs at sfu teaching organic chem, would definitely recommend him. Sure he yells but he wants you to get the message across and wants u to learn to ur full capability. His exams are pretty fair in my opinion, but u will never be bored in his class if u are he can smell it in the air and will call u out, he loves the Canucks aswell

Dr. Merbouh is a really amazing prof. Sure he yells at students sometimes (I've been yelled at too!), but he really cares about whether we understand stuff. That's why he schedules review sessions and encourages questions. No other prof devotes this much time to giving extra help, and for that he deserves good ratings. Pretty hot too ;)

I don't know what he was like back then, but right now, he's one of the most condescending professors I've had the pleasure of meeting. His lectures are great, but his tests need to pertain more to the course material he went over in class and tutorials. He needs to learn what "scaling" means (hint: it's not about screwing over the top students)
he is a great prof! lectures are interesting and he has a good sense of humor! he is kind of hot (obviously cuz he is french;)!

I think Nabyl is awesome. Yes, it's true that he'll yell at you and humiliate you in front of everyone... but that just means you're asking for it. Don't ask dumb questions, think about it first. He'll explain something numerous times if you need it but not if you're looking at him like a deer in the head lights. His exams were fair if you studied.
best prof ever!!!!!!!!!!! Extremely friendly and helpful.Makes the lab procedure extremely easy to follow. If you like a laid back instructor he's the one to take.
Just an awesome guy.

In the first lab he said, I don't care what you do, as long as you are safe and have fun.  And he meant it.  He said he cares more about you learning the lab procedures rather than all the fancy theory cuz we learn that in lecture.  He is the easiest lab professor I've ever had and also the nicest.  Would highly recomment him.
He's the lab prof. Really funny and tries to get you interested in the subject. Can seem a bit intimidating, but he really is a nice guy. His explanations are very clear. Think before you speak!
sweet heart if you ACTUALLY get to know him. Yes he has a mean exterior
Very funny, helpful and charming!
Good man!
